intro: Dichapetalum alaotrense, commonly known as the Alaotra mallow, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and is valued for its ornamental qualities. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
